subject: Re: how to name the letters
msgSnippet: Or consonants could be named by the words they represent in Senior, with the exception of /p/, /ʒ/ and /dʒ/ which currently do not have associated
messageBody:
Or consonants could be named by the words they represent in Senior, with the exception of /p/, /ʒ/ and /dʒ/ which currently do not have associated abbreviations.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...> wrote:
>
> On Apr 22, 2013, at 6:18 AM, BPJ <bpj@...> wrote:
> > Nathan, if you are listening, I'd suggest adding a "broad
> > X-SAMPA" version avoiding non-letters like so:
> >
> > ROE = /r/
> > AT = /a/
> > UTTER = /V/
> > OWE = /oU/ ~ /Vu/
> >
> What's so bad about r\ , {, and @? I'm not exactly chomping at the bit to add another checkbox to the UI.
> > Moreover you might want to change the OWE transcription
> > to "/oU/ ~ /@U/" with the tilde outside the slashes,
> > since the tilde in X-SAMPA symbolizes (vowel)
> > nasalization, like in French.
> >
>
> Fixed. Thanks!
>
